vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
κερᾱτ-ιον, τό,
diminutive of κέρας, small horn, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__2 of the antennae of the κάραβος, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; of the hermit-crab,[Refs]
__3 in plural, curved ends of the womb [Refs]
__4 musical instrument, perhaps fife or clarionet, [Refs 2nd c.BC+]
__II carat, 1/1728 of a pound, [Refs 2nd c.BC+]; = Latin siliqua, [Refs 5th c.AD+]
__III ={κερατωνία}, [Refs]
__IV see at {κεράτια}.
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
carob podhusk
primarily a little horn; in NT a pod, the pod of the carob tree, or Ceratonia siliqua of Linnaeus, a common tree in the East and the south of Europe, growing to a considerable size, and producing long slender pods, with a pulp of a sweetish taste, and several brown shining seeds like beans, sometimes eaten by the poorer people in Syria and Palestine, and commonly used for fattening swine, Lk. 15:16*
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
角豆莢
角豆樹的莢形狀如角,有甜味,用來給豬添肥,但是低階層人的食物. (路 15:16)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
角豆荚
角豆树的荚形状如角,有甜味,用来给猪添肥,但是低阶层人的食物. (路 15:16)
